content: issue 1 september 2017 rough diamonds a rectangular shawl crochet pattern by jo creates i ve been inspired by the scheepjes whirl range of yarn the way the colour fades is fantastic and i love working with it i made a triangle shawl but its not really me i much prefer a rectangular wrap / pashmina as i find them more practical i wanted something that had a simple pattern so that the main effect was from the scheepjes whirl why not a set of diamonds - every girl loves a diamond right © joanna hardy 2017 all rights reserved you may not reproduce or sell this pattern in any form rough diamonds rectangular shawl page 2 of 17 introduction suggested yarn this pattern has been designed for use with one ball of scheepjes whirl it s a 4ply fingering weight yarn so substituting with any similar yarn should work each whirl is between 215-225g and measures 1000m in length hook 2mm or whatever hook required to get to gauge finished size 158cm wide by 46cm deep gauge 21 5 stitches per 10cm and 12 row per 10 cm pre-blocking using treble_crochet stitches if you are using scheepjes whirl gauge is fairly important it is designed to use one ball and to get the full effect of the colour transition it uses pretty much the whole ball you might have a little bit left over i ve given tips for weighing half-way through to make sure you are on gauge if you are slightly out then you can skip the penultimate row without affecting the pattern in an obvious way if you are using any other yarn gauge isn t too important suitable for anyone with experience of making chain and treble_crochet stitches i ve tried my best to explain the stages as simply as possible i ve also put some additional hints and tips on my blog feel free to have a look you can find them here www oorr sseellll tthhiiss ppaatttteerrnn iinn aannyy ffoorrmm notes this is a filet crochet pattern where the design is made up by making chain-space stitches because of this the easiest way to demonstrate this pattern is using a chart i know not everyone likes reading charts trust me this one is super simple though and so i ve also included written instructions at the end for simplicity i ve coloured the holes in grey on the chart each hole is made by chaining 2 and skipping the two stitches beneath it whenever you see a chain 2 skip the two stitches beneath the pattern instructions will hopefully describe this further if that isn t clear the chart is split up over 8 pages page 1 of the pattern starts on page 3 of this pattern and is put back together as follows this should also give you an idea of the overall design for this
